intro: Goniolimon serbicum, commonly known as the Serbica limon, is a rare and specialized plant species native to the Balkan region. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and succulent leaves. The plant thrives in calcareous soils and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered an endangered species. Conservation efforts are essential to protect this unique botanical specimen.
